block.p: Alicia Trinidad Ybarbo, a daughter of Irene and Paul Ybarbo of Woodland, Calif., was married last evening to Mark Thomas Zimmerman, the son of Ira and Edith Zimmerman of Hastings-on-Hudson, N.Y. Rabbi Jerry Winston officiated at the Viansa Winery in Sonoma, Calif. The Rev. Gordon Kalil, a Roman Catholic priest, took part in the ceremony.

Ms. Ybarbo, 29, who is keeping her name, is a segment producer for ''Later Today,'' an NBC-TV morning program. She graduated from the University of California at Davis, from which her father retired as a staff electrician. Her mother is the assistant to the director of the religious education program at Holy Rosary Parish in Woodland, Calif.

Alicia Trinidad Ybarbo, a daughter of Irene and Paul Ybarbo of Woodland, Calif., was married last evening to Mark Thomas Zimmerman, the son of Ira and Edith Zimmerman of Hastings-on-Hudson, N.Y. Rabbi Jerry Winston officiated at the Viansa Winery in Sonoma, Calif. The Rev. Gordon Kalil, a Roman Catholic priest, took part in the ceremony.

Ms. Ybarbo, 29, who is keeping her name, is a segment producer for ''Later Today,'' an NBC-TV morning program. She graduated from the University of California at Davis, from which her father retired as a staff electrician. Her mother is the assistant to the director of the religious education program at Holy Rosary Parish in Woodland, Calif.

Mr. Zimmerman, 31, is the senior manager of programming development for N.F.L. New Media, which manages the National Football League's Web site, NFL.com. He graduated from Union College in Schenectady, N.Y. His father retired as the New York bureau chief of NBC News in New York. The bridegroom's mother is a real estate agent at Peter J. Riolo, Better Homes and Gardens, in Hastings.
